intro: Cynanchum analamazaotrense, commonly known as the Madagascar milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is typical of the genus Cynanchum. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and display a variety of colors, including yellow and green. This species is adapted to the humid and tropical climates of its native region, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
